sub_title: Senior Researcher at World Benchmarking Alliance | Quantitative Economist and Data Analyst
summary: I’m an experienced Senior Researcher with a demonstrated history of working in international affairs and sustainability. My passion for socioeconomic development has driven me to assess the world's leading technology companies as part of the world's first Digital Inclusion Benchmark. I lead company engagement and curate a list of the world's 2000 most influential companies for achieving the Sustainable Development Goals by 2030. Before this, my journey included leading randomised control trials with J-Pal in South Africa as a Senior Research analyst; and traveled through Southern and East Africa profiling and showcasing the work of youth entrepreneurs with the Building Bridges Foundation. Through this experience, I have honed my skills in sustainability research, quantitative economics, data analysis, policy analysis and project management in Africa and Europe.

awards.title: Global Citizenship Leading for Social Justice Award
awards.description: The Global Citizenship Programme is a programme of critical debate, voluntary service activities and reflection which engages students as thoughtful scholars and citizens who are interested in learning about, thinking about, critiquing and responding to key contemporary issues.
awards.issuer: Centre for Higher Education and Development

projects.title: Allan Gray Orbis Foundation Fellow
projects.description:
The Allan Gray Orbis Foundation works to promote entrepreneurial leadership and thereby prosperity in an integrated Southern Africa. The Foundation seeks to achieve this through equipping talented young individuals (“Fellows”) with the skills, and motivation to become successful high growth entrepreneurial leaders through a four-year Entrepreneurial Development Programme.

As part of the leadership portfolio, I assisted in organising local and international experiential learning trips as well as leadership talks and discussions.

contributors.headline: Senior Researcher at World Benchmarking Alliance | Quantitative Economist and Data Analyst

projects.title: UCT Global Citizenship: Leading for Social Justice Programme
projects.description:
The UCT Global Citizenship: Leading for Social Justice Programme is a co-curricular programme providing students with an opportunity to engage critically with contemporary global debates and to reflect on issues of citizenship and social justice. The programme is supported by the University as a way of promoting values of engaged citizenship and social justice among UCT graduates as outlined in the UCT mission.

The programme currently has three inter-linked but separate components:
•GC 1: Global Debates, Local Voices workshop series 
•GC 2: Service, citizenship and social justice service learning course (including 10 hours of community service organised through the course) 
•GC 3: Voluntary community service – 60 hours (self organised) with a recognised student-run, NGO, faith-based or community-based organisation 

Upon graduation, students are awarded with the Global Citizenship Award which reflects on their university academic transcripts.

projects.title: Pan African Youth Dialogue Summit

profile_positions.description:
As a Senior Researcher, I conduct sustainability research and data analysis across the world's leading digital technology companies for the world's first global Digital Inclusion Benchmark. In addition, I oversee project management for the research, lead the benchmark's global company engagement and support the benchmark strategy. 

My second research focus is managing and developing the SDG2000, the world's the leading companies that will have a disproportionate influence on meeting the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by 2030. This role includes strategic planning, data analysis and deriving insights as well as stakeholder engagement across WBA's research. 

The outcomes of my research are used by governments, investors, and various stakeholders in the field of sustainability to inform their understanding of company performance on the SDGs.
profile_positions.title: Senior Researcher

profile_positions.description: As a Research Analyst I conducted in-depth research and support the development of the WBA’s benchmarks. I focused on digital inclusion research and data analysis across the world's leading digital technology companies. In addition, I oversaw the project management and supported the development of the SDG2000, the world's the leading companies that will have a disproportionate influence on meeting the UN SDGs.
profile_positions.title: Research Analyst

profile_positions.description: As a Data Analyst, I conducted in-depth data analysis on survey data collected by Index Initiative during the World Benchmark Alliance's (WBA) consultation and engagement process. In addition to this, I contributed to and supported research, strategy and the development of WBA's benchmarks.
profile_positions.title: Data Analyst

profile_positions.description: As a Sustainability and Climate Consultant I conduct research and  prepare guidance related to climate and energy issues in South Africa.
profile_positions.title: Sustainability, Climate and Energy Consultant

profile_positions.description:
The Road to Nairobi 2016 is a Building Bridges project which connected with youth entrepreneurs and local changemakers in eight African countries to foster youth employment.
 
The Building Bridges team of African and European youth conducted field visits to youth entrepreneurs, met with local youth organisations and engaged youngsters from all walks of life they met on the road. At the end of each country visit, a multi-stakeholder event was held where entrepreneurs presented their lived case studies and discussions were held to propose better youth-focused policies. 

I worked as a Project Manager and Researcher where I conducted country level desk and field research in South Africa, Mozambique, Zimbabwe, Malawi, Tanzania, Kenya, Uganda and Rwanda. The outcomes of the study were presented at the Second High-Level Meeting for the Global Partnership for Effective Development Cooperation in Kenya. The research output was published as a book and a research report in collaboration with the UN SDG Action Campaign.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager and Researcher

profile_positions.description:
The Building Bridges Foundation is a not-for-profit organization established in the Netherlands. Their mission is to foster youth-led solutions from the grassroots to contribute towards the effective implementation of the Sustainable Development Goals. 

The mission of the Building Bridges 2015 Project was to picture the post-2015 agenda from a different perspective; focusing on the priorities of young people and women on the grassroots level and their vision of the world in 2030. 

As the South African Youth Ambassador, I oversaw project management related to South Africa's involvement in the Building Bridges 2015 Project while working to engage and inspire young South Africans on topics including gender equality and the post-2015 UN agenda.
profile_positions.title: South African Youth Ambassador

company.name: Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL)

profile_positions.company: Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL)
profile_positions.description:
As a Research Associate (RA) with J-PAL, I worked on a study focused on South African labour markets. 
The study investigated how individuals signal their skills, abilities and productivity during the job search process. Furthermore, the study investigated gender dynamics and possible improvements to the job search process for over 3000 individuals. Research from the study has been published in major economic journals, including the American Economic Journal. In addition, the South African Department of Labour is implementing the results of the investigation. As the RA, I managed the day to day activities of the project, field and desk research and data analysis.
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Associate

profile_positions.location: The Hostel Office, The Fringe, Cape Town
profile_positions.description: As a Communications Researcher, I worked on coordinating communications in the form of newsletters, the company website and contact with partners and stakeholders. In addition to this, I researched the area for creative economic development research, working towards a Creative Business Attraction and Retention Strategy for the district.
profile_positions.title: The Fringe: Communications Researcher
